Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-02-27T14:40:10Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Collection of African Colonial Collectible Sticker Albums TAM.776
2.0 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box, 1 half manuscript box, 1 flat box and 2 oversize flat folders
circa 1920-1975, undated Materials in Dutch, English, French, and Spanish. The materials in this collection are primarily albums to hold collectible stickers and stamps. Some of the albums were made by corporations as promotional and educational tools to market their products. The albums all depict life, people, and landscapes of European colonies in Africa, with the bulk of albums focused on the Democratic Republic of Congo (formerly known as the Belgian Congo). Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of 17 albums of trading cards and stamps from the 1920s through the 1970s. The bulk of these albums focus on life in the Belgian Congo (later known as the Democratic Republic of Congo), Rhodesia, and other European colonies in Africa. The albums and cards were produced by corporations such as Players Tobacco, Astra Confectioners, and a variety of chocolatiers. The stamps were packaged with their products and used for marketing and promotional purposes. The bulk of the albums in this collection were intended for children. This collection illustrates the intersection of colonialism and advertising, and how colonial life was portrayed to the people living on the mainland.
The collection also includes an undated poster for a student protest of colonialism, a promotional poster about rubber plantations in the Belgian Congo, and three prints illustrating life in the colonies of Kenya and Rhodesia.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
There is no documentation concerning the acquisition of these materials. The accession number associated with this collection is 2019.014.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Collection of African Colonial Collectible Sticker Albums; TAM 776; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were sorted by size, placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. A collection-level description and box-level inventory were created to describe the contents of this collection.
